	As of the close of business on February&nbsp;17, 2017, there were 774,334,281
	shares of the registrant&#146;s Common Stock outstanding. The aggregate market value of the registrant&#146;s voting and non-voting common equity securities held by non-affiliates of the registrant (based upon the closing price of such shares on the
	New York Stock Exchange on June&nbsp;30, 2016) was approximately $56.86 billion.

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">

	Table of Contents

</H5>
<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	PART&nbsp;I
</B>
</P>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Item&nbsp;1.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Business.
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Time Warner Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148; or &#147;Time Warner&#148;), a Delaware corporation, is a leading media and
	entertainment company. The Company classifies its businesses into the following three reportable segments:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="9%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Turner, consisting principally of cable networks and digital media properties;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="9%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Home Box Office, consisting principally of premium pay television and OTT services (as defined below)
	domestically and premium pay, basic tier television and OTT services internationally; and
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="9%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Warner Bros., consisting principally of television, feature film, home video and videogame production and
	distribution.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For more information about the Company&#146;s reportable segments, see
	&#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Results of Operations and Financial Condition &#151; Overview.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As used in this report, the term &#147;affiliates&#148; refers to distributors that deliver packages of networks to their
	subscribers, including cable system operators, satellite service distributors and telephone companies (&#147;traditional affiliates&#148;) and virtual multichannel video programming distributors (&#147;virtual MVPDs&#148;); and the term &#147;OTT
	services&#148; refers to services that deliver video content to consumers over the Internet and includes subscription video-on-demand (&#147;SVOD&#148;) services and advertising-supported VOD (&#147;AVOD&#148;) services such as social media
	platforms and user-generated content digital platforms, but does not include virtual MVPDs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On October&nbsp;22, 2016,
	Time Warner entered into an Agreement and Plan of Merger (the &#147;Merger Agreement&#148;) with AT&amp;T Inc. (&#147;AT&amp;T&#148;), West Merger Sub, Inc. and West Merger Sub II, LLC, pursuant to which Time Warner will combine with AT&amp;T in a
	stock-and-cash transaction. The Merger Agreement has been approved unanimously by the boards of directors of both companies. Time Warner shareholders adopted the Merger Agreement at a special meeting of shareholders held on February&nbsp;15, 2017.
	Subject to the satisfaction of the remaining conditions in the Merger Agreement, upon consummation of the merger, Time Warner&#146;s shareholders will receive per share consideration consisting of $53.75 in cash and a specified number of shares of
	AT&amp;T stock, as set forth in the Merger Agreement and determined by reference to the average of the volume weighted averages of the trading price of AT&amp;T common stock on the New York Stock Exchange (&#147;NYSE&#148;) on each of the 15
	consecutive NYSE trading days ending on and including the trading day that is three trading days prior to the closing of the merger (the &#147;Average Stock Price&#148;). The stock portion of the per share consideration will be subject to a collar
	such that if the Average Stock Price is between $37.411 and $41.349, Time Warner shareholders will receive shares of AT&amp;T stock equal to $53.75 in value for each share of Time Warner common stock. If the Average Stock Price is below $37.411,
	Time Warner&#146;s shareholders will receive 1.437 AT&amp;T shares for each share of Time Warner common stock. If the Average Stock Price is above $41.349, Time Warner shareholders will receive 1.300 AT&amp;T shares for each share of Time Warner
	common stock. The merger is conditioned on the receipt of certain antitrust and other required regulatory consents. The merger is expected to close before year-end 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Time Warner&#146;s business is focused on the production and distribution of high-quality video content to take advantage of
	growing global demand. Time Warner&#146;s businesses work together to leverage their strong brands, distinctive intellectual property and global scale to produce and distribute content that resonates deeply with consumers. As the television industry
	continues to evolve, with developments in technology, rapid growth of new video services and shifting consumer viewing habits, Time Warner is well-positioned to address and capitalize on these changes. Accordingly, the Company is focused on both
	strengthening its position within the traditional TV ecosystem and pursuing growth opportunities outside the ecosystem, including increasing the content and services offered directly to consumers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Within the traditional TV ecosystem, the Company is a leader in improving the value of traditional multichannel video service
	subscriptions for consumers and affiliates. The Company is continuing to increase its investment in high-quality distinctive programming, make more of its content available on-demand and on a growing variety of devices and invest in technology to
	enhance the consumer experience. To make television advertising on Turner&#146;s networks more attractive and valuable to advertisers and more relevant to consumers, Turner is pursuing a number of initiatives, including developing new advertising
	offerings that use data and analytics to enable advertisers to better reach their target audiences and improve their ability to measure the effectiveness of their advertisements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	1
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage3"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company is also capitalizing on growth opportunities outside the traditional
	TV ecosystem by increasing its investments in new digital products and technologies, including launching OTT services, as well as investing in and obtaining distribution of its content through other companies&#146; OTT services. To support this
	effort, Time Warner is investing in content that will appeal to consumers who view it in a multi-platform, on-demand environment and building technological capabilities, such as in data analytics, video transport and digital product management. In
	addition, the Company is focused on increasing the digital sales and rentals of its film and television content and is a leader in various initiatives designed to make digital ownership of content more compelling for consumers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The merger with AT&amp;T is consistent with the Company&#146;s strategy of ensuring that its content is available to consumers
	on a wide range of distribution platforms. The Company expects the merger will accelerate the Company&#146;s efforts to spur innovation in the media industry and improve the consumer experience in pay television bundles by creating compelling
	consumer offerings and developing more targeted advertising offerings, and it will accelerate and reduce the risk in Time Warner&#146;s strategy to distribute content through other online and mobile services, including those offered directly to
	consumers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2016, the Company had a total of approximately 25,000 employees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For convenience, the terms the &#147;Company,&#148; &#147;Time Warner&#148; and the &#147;Registrant&#148; are used in this
	report to refer to both the parent company alone and collectively to the parent company and the subsidiaries through which its various businesses are conducted, unless the context requires otherwise. In addition, the term &#147;Home Box Office&#148;
	is used to refer to Home Box Office, Inc., a subsidiary of Time Warner, the term &#147;Turner&#148; is used to refer to Turner Broadcasting System, Inc., a subsidiary of Time Warner, and the term &#147;Warner Bros.&#148; is used to refer to Warner
	Bros. Entertainment Inc., a subsidiary of Time Warner.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	under no obligation to, and expressly disclaims any such obligation to, update or alter its forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise. Time Warner&#146;s actual results may vary materially from
	those expressed or implied by the statements in this report due to changes in economic, business, competitive, technological, strategic and/or regulatory factors and other factors affecting the operation of Time Warner&#146;s businesses. For more
	detailed information about these factors and risk factors with respect to the Company&#146;s operations, see Item&nbsp;1A, &#147;Risk Factors,&#148; and &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Results of Operations and Financial
	Condition&nbsp;&#151; Caution Concerning Forward-Looking Statements.&#148;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<I>
	Available Information and Website
</I>
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company&#146;s annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K, quarterly reports on Form&nbsp;10-Q, current reports on Form&nbsp;8-K and
	any amendments to such reports filed with or furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#147;SEC&#148;) pursuant to Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;), are
	available free of charge on the Company&#146;s website at
<I>
	www.timewarner.com
</I>
	as soon as reasonably practicable after such reports are electronically filed with or furnished to the SEC. The Company is providing the address to its website
	solely for the information of investors. The Company does not intend the address to be an active link or to incorporate any information included on or accessible through its website into this report.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURNER
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Turner creates and programs branded news, entertainment, sports and kids multi-platform content for consumers around the
	world. Turner operates more than 175 channels globally. In the U.S., its networks and related businesses and brands include TNT, TBS, Adult Swim, truTV, Turner Classic Movies, Turner Sports, Bleacher Report, the NBA and NCAA digital properties,
	Cartoon Network, Boomerang, CNN, the CNN digital network, HLN and iStreamPlanet. Outside the U.S., Turner&#146;s portfolio of brands and digital businesses reaches consumers in more than 200 countries and territories.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	2
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Turner&#146;s programming is primarily distributed by affiliates and is available
	to subscribers of the affiliates for viewing live and on demand on television and on various Internet-connected devices through the affiliates&#146; services and Turner&#146;s network apps. Turner is also pursuing non-traditional distribution
	options for its programming. In November 2016, Turner launched its first domestic SVOD service, FilmStruck, aimed at arthouse film enthusiasts. Some of Turner&#146;s programming is also available on other companies&#146; OTT services.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Turner&#146;s digital properties consist of its own digital properties and those it manages and/or operates for sports leagues
	where Turner holds the related programming rights. Turner&#146;s CNN digital network is the leading digital news destination, based on the number of average monthly domestic multi-platform unique visitors for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016,
	and Turner&#146;s Bleacher Report was the leading digital sports destination across Facebook, Instagram and Twitter for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 (based on data sourced from CrowdTangle). Turner&#146;s other digital properties include
	its apps for CNN, TBS, TNT, Adult Swim and Cartoon Network, which enable viewers who subscribe to those networks through an affiliate to view the network programming live and on demand through the apps, as well as&nbsp;
<I>
	tntdrama.com
</I>
	,
<I>
	TBS.com
</I>
	,
<I>
	adultswim.com
</I>
	and
<I>
	cartoonnetwork.com
</I>
	. Digital properties Turner manages and/or operates for sports leagues include
<I>
	NBA.com
</I>
	, the
<I>
	NBA
</I>
	app,
<I>
	NCAA.com
</I>
	, the
<I>
	NCAA March Madness Live
</I>
	app and
<I>
	PGA.com
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Turner continues to focus on improving the value of traditional multichannel video service subscriptions
	for consumers and affiliates and enhancing the value of television advertising for advertisers. It is strengthening the programming on its cable networks by increasing its investment in high-quality original programming, modifying the mix of
	programming on its networks to increase the amount of original programming and re-branding some of its networks. In 2016, Turner launched rebrands of TNT and TBS, shifting its programming toward high-quality distinctive original series that are
	aimed at engaging younger audiences across multiple viewing platforms. In addition, over the past several years, Turner has broadened the scope of CNN&#146;s programming to include compelling storytelling about important events, people and places
	through original programming, long-form documentaries and films and has strengthened the programming at truTV, where it has rebranded the network to focus on comedy-driven reality and scripted series aimed at young adults. Turner also is continuing
	to expand the amount of its programming available on demand to its affiliates&#146; subscribers, including complete current seasons of programming from Turner&#146;s networks. As part of its efforts to deliver more value to advertisers and improve
	the consumer experience, Turner continues to support industry efforts to improve the measurement of viewing and audience engagement across all platforms and is offering new data- and analytics-driven advertising products to enable advertisers to
	better reach their target audiences and measure the effectiveness of their advertisements, while making advertisements more relevant to consumers. In addition, in 2016, Turner began reducing the advertising loads on primetime original programs on
	truTV and on certain new original series on TNT.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Turner is also increasing its investments in new digital technology and
	products and different types of content to capitalize on growth opportunities outside the traditional TV ecosystem. To improve its digital streaming capabilities, in 2015, Turner acquired a majority ownership interest in iStreamPlanet Co., LLC
	(&#147;iStreamPlanet&#148;), a provider of streaming and cloud-based video and technology services that specializes in streaming large scale, live sporting events. In November 2016, Turner launched its first domestic SVOD service, FilmStruck, which
	offers contemporary and classic arthouse, independent and foreign films and related content. Turner is also developing content for distribution outside the traditional television ecosystem. These initiatives include Great Big Story, an independent
	storytelling brand that creates original digital content aimed at urban millennial audiences and is distributed via social media platforms, and Super Deluxe, a comedy-focused digital production studio that produces content for its own audiences on
	social media platforms, as well as other programming distributors and sponsors. Turner is also increasingly investing in programming for its networks that will engage audiences across multiple platforms.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Turner is continuing to increase its scale and strengthen its competitive position internationally through strategic regional
	channel launches, partnerships and acquisitions in key territories, and it is placing greater emphasis on creating local programming to strengthen its brands internationally.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Entertainment
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Domestic Entertainment
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Turner&#146;s domestic entertainment networks collectively provide a blend of original series, acquired series and movies,
	sports and reality programming. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, Turner&#146;s TBS, TNT and Adult Swim were three of
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	3
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	the top five primetime advertising-supported cable networks among adults 18-49 in the U.S., and Adult Swim was the top advertising-supported cable network in total day among adults 18-34 in the
	U.S. In 2016, Adult Swim received three Primetime Emmy Awards. Turner has been increasing the amount of original programming on TNT and TBS, and it plans to continue to do so over the next several years. Ownership of a larger portion of its content
	provides Turner the flexibility to offer consumers access to more of its content through on demand platforms and take advantage of increasing licensing opportunities both domestically and internationally. In addition, Turner has made significant
	investments in premium sports programming and motion pictures that air on its entertainment networks, including licensing the cable network television rights to popular films from franchises such as Warner Bros.&#146; franchise films based on DC
	Entertainment characters and the
<I>
	Star Wars
</I>
	,
<I>
	Marvel Comics
</I>
	and
<I>
	The Hunger Games
</I>
	film franchises, all of which will air exclusively on TBS and TNT. As described above, Turner began reducing the advertising loads for certain
	programs on truTV and TNT in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	TNT
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	TNT is focused on distinctive dramas and is home to syndicated series and a growing roster of original series, as well as
	sports and network premiere motion pictures. As of December 2016, TNT reached 91.0&nbsp;million domestic television households as reported by Nielsen Media Research (&#147;Nielsen&#148;). For the 2016-2017 season, TNT&#146;s returning original
	series include
<I>
	The Last Ship
</I>
	,
<I>
	The Librarians
</I>
	and
<I>
	Major Crimes
</I>
	, and its new original series include
<I>
	Animal Kingdom
</I>
	and
<I>
	Good Behavior
</I>
	. For the 2016-2017 season, TNT&#146;s syndicated series include
<I>
	Bones
</I>
	,
<I>
	Castle
</I>
	,
<I>
	Charmed
</I>
	,
<I>
	Grimm
</I>
	and
<I>
	Supernatural
</I>
	.&nbsp;The network&#146;s upcoming slate includes several new original dramas, including
<I>
	The Alienist
</I>
	,
<I>
	Claws
</I>
	and
<I>
	Will
</I>
	, many of which are co-produced and co-owned
	by Turner. TNT and TBS are home to the
<I>
	Screen Actors Guild Awards
</I>
	, and TNT, TBS and truTV are home to the
<I>
	iHeartRadio Music Awards
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	TBS
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	TBS
	is focused on fresh comedies aimed at a younger audience, with a growing roster of original series, as well as sports and acquired television series and movies. As of December 2016, TBS reached 92.5&nbsp;million domestic television households as
	reported by Nielsen. For the 2016-2017 season, TBS&#146; returning original series include
<I>
	American Dad
</I>
	,
<I>
	Angie Tribeca
</I>
	,
<I>
	The Detour
</I>
	and
<I>
	Wrecked
</I>
	, and its new original series include
<I>
	The Guest Book
</I>
	,
<I>
	People of
	Earth
</I>
	and
<I>
	Search Party
</I>
	. Syndicated series for the 2016-2017 season include
<I>
	2 Broke Girls
</I>
	,
<I>
	The Big Bang Theory
</I>
	,
<I>
	Family Guy
</I>
	,
<I>
	Friends
</I>
	,
<I>
	New Girl
</I>
	and
<I>
	Seinfeld
</I>
	. TBS is also the home of the late night
	talk shows
<I>
	Conan
</I>
	and
<I>
	Full Frontal with Samantha Bee
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Adult Swim
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Adult Swim is an evening and overnight block of programming airing on Turner&#146;s Cartoon Network. As of December 2016,
	Adult Swim reached 91.6&nbsp;million domestic television households as reported by Nielsen. Adult Swim is aimed at millennial audiences and offers original and syndicated animated and live-action comedy programming. For the 2016-2017 season, Adult
	Swim&#146;s original series include
<I>
	Black Jesus
</I>
	,
<I>

	truTV

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	truTV focuses on comedy-driven reality and scripted series aimed at young adult audiences with the tag line &#147;Funny

	Turner Classic Movies

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Turner Classic Movies is a commercial-free network that presents classic films from some of the largest film libraries in the
	world. Turner Classic Movies also offers interviews, original documentaries, specials and regular programming events that include &#147;The Essentials,&#148; &#147;31 Days of Oscar&#148; and &#147;Summer Under the Stars.&#148;

<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	International Entertainment
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Outside the U.S., Turner owns and/or operates regional entertainment networks providing a variety of programming, such as
	motion pictures and series, documentaries, fashion and lifestyle content, music videos, sports and travel. In Latin America, Turner is the number one provider of multichannel television in the region and owns and operates regional entertainment
	networks, including Glitz*, HTV, I-Sat, MuchMusic, Space, TBS, TCM, TNT, TNT Serie, truTV and Warner TV. Turner also owns and operates Chilevisi&oacute;n, a free-to-air television broadcaster in Chile, and Esporte Interativo, a Brazilian linear
	television channel and OTT service that airs sports programming, including programming from South American and European soccer leagues. Turner also operates several regional entertainment networks in Europe and the Middle East, including TCM, TNT,
	TNT Comedy, TNT Serie, TNT Film and truTV. In Asia, Turner operates several regional entertainment networks, including Oh!K, TCM and Warner TV in Hong Kong, HBO South Asia and WarnerTV in India, Oh!K, TCM, truTV and Warner TV in Indonesia and
	Singapore, and MondoTV and Tabi Channel in Japan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Sports
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Turner Sports produces award-winning sports programming and content for Turner&#146;s TNT, TBS and truTV networks and related
	digital properties. Turner&#146;s sports programming helps drive value across its networks in the form of higher affiliate fees, ratings and advertising rates as well as more promotional opportunities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Turner&#146;s sports programming features licensed programming from the National Basketball Association (&#147;NBA&#148;)
	through the 2024-2025 season, Major League Baseball (&#147;MLB&#148;) through 2021, The National Collegiate Athletic Association (the &#147;NCAA&#148;) for the Men&#146;s Division I Basketball Tournament through 2032, and the Professional
	Golfers&#146; Association (&#147;PGA&#148;) through 2019. NBA games and PGA tournaments air on the TNT network, and MLB games air on the TBS network. TNT airs the studio program
<I>
	Inside the NBA
</I>
	and the reality competition series,
<I>
	The Dunk
	King
</I>
	. Turner also operates NBA TV, an advertising-supported cable network owned by the NBA, featuring NBA exhibition, regular season and playoff games and related programming. The NCAA Men&#146;s Division I Basketball Tournament games air on the
	TNT, TBS and truTV networks and on the CBS network under an agreement among Turner, CBS Broadcasting, Inc. and the NCAA. In 2016, Turner&#146;s networks carried the NCAA Final Four semifinal games and championship game and, after 2016, Turner&#146;s
	networks and CBS will carry the NCAA Final Four semifinal games and championship game in alternate years. Turner also has partnered with WME|IMG to form ELEAGUE, a multiplayer competitive videogaming league. Live coverage of ELEAGUE gaming events
	and a weekly showcase program airs on TBS and live coverage of the events and related on-demand programming are also available through the Twitch OTT platform.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Bleacher Report is a leading digital sports property that provides team-specific sports content and real-time event coverage
	and provides Turner with cross-platform programming and marketing opportunities. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, Bleacher Report&#146;s Team Stream app was the most engaging sports app, with 147.5 average monthly minutes spent per visitor
	(based on data sourced from comScore Mobile Metrix). Turner also manages and operates
<I>
	NCAA.com
</I>
	, the
<I>
	NCAA March Madness Live
</I>
	app, which provides live and on-demand streaming video of games,
<I>
	NBA.com
</I>
	and the
<I>
	NBA
</I>
	app, which
	provide live streaming of games, and
<I>
	PGA.com
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Kids
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Cartoon Network and Boomerang offer original, acquired and classic animated and live-action entertainment aimed at kids in the
	U.S. and international territories. Turner has been focused on significantly expanding its global kids business, increasing its collaboration with Warner Bros. on television programming based on Warner Bros.&#146; and DC Entertainment&#146;s brands
	and characters and growing its consumer products business. The collaboration with Warner Bros. is intended to drive the success of Cartoon Network and Boomerang and foster broader global exposure for Warner Bros.&#146; existing brands and franchises
	while also helping launch new long-term franchises and increase consumer product sales. Warner Bros. is producing original animated programming based on its characters and brands for Cartoon Network and Boomerang, and Turner and Warner Bros. are
	jointly producing original animated programming such as
<I>
	Be Cool Scooby Doo
</I>
	,
<I>
	New Looney Tunes
</I>
	and
<I>
	The Tom and Jerry Show
</I>
	. Turner and Warner Bros. are also producing and distributing content for DC Super Hero Girls, a franchise
	centered on iconic female
<I>
	DC Entertainment
</I>
	characters.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	News
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	CNN
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	CNN is the original
	cable television news service. As of December 2016, CNN reached 92.3&nbsp;million domestic television households as reported by Nielsen.&nbsp;As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, CNN managed 39 news bureaus and editorial operations, 29 of which are located
	outside the U.S. Turner is focused on maintaining CNN&#146;s leadership in worldwide breaking-news, investigative and political coverage while continuing to broaden the scope of its programming, including by increasing the number of original series
	and films, mini-series and documentaries. In 2016, CNN received seven Emmy Awards. For the 2016-2017 season, CNN&#146;s news programs include
<I>
	Anderson Cooper 360
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	o
</SUP>
</I>
	,
<I>

	Lemon
</I>

</I>

</I>

	2016-2017 season, CNN has aired films and mini-series including

</I>

	The End: Inside the Last Days of the Obama White House

	CNN is also focused on expanding its leading digital presence by developing mobile products, increasing the amount of original short form video content it offers through digital platforms, including through its independent storytelling brand Great
	Big Story, and growing its digital presence in several brand extensions, including personal finance (CNN Money) and political news (CNN Politics).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Internationally, CNN reaches approximately 300&nbsp;million households outside the U.S. as of December&nbsp;31, 2016. CNN
	Worldwide is a portfolio of more than 20 news and information services across cable, satellite, radio, wireless devices and the Internet in more than 200 countries and territories as of December&nbsp;31, 2016. CNN Worldwide&#146;s networks and
	businesses include CNN U.S., CNN International, CNN en Espa&ntilde;ol, CNNj, CNN.com, CNN Airport Network, CNN Radio, CNN Newsource and HLN.

<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	How Turner Generates Revenues
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Turner generates revenues principally from licensing programming to affiliates that have contracted to receive and distribute
	the programming to subscribers, the sale of advertising on its networks and the digital properties it owns or manages for other companies, and the license of its original programming and its brands and characters for consumer products and other
	business ventures. Turner&#146;s license agreements with its affiliates are typically multi-year arrangements that provide for annual service fee increases and have fee arrangements that are generally related to the number of subscribers served by
	the affiliate, the package of programming provided to the affiliate by each network and the competitive environment. Turner&#146;s advertising revenues are generated from a wide variety of advertiser categories, and the advertising arrangements for
	its networks generally have terms of one year or less. In the U.S., the advertising revenues generated by Turner are a function of the size and demographics of the audience delivered, the number of units of time sold and the price per unit. Turner
	sells some of its advertising inventory in the &#147;upfront&#148; market in advance each year and other inventory in the &#147;scatter&#148; market closer to the time a program airs. Outside the U.S., advertising is generally sold at a fixed rate
	for the unit of time sold, determined by the time of day and network.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	HOME BOX OFFICE
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Home Box Office owns and operates leading multichannel premium pay television services, HBO and Cinemax. Its businesses
	consist principally of premium pay television and OTT services domestically and premium pay, basic tier television and OTT services internationally, as well as home entertainment and content licensing. Home Box Office is a leader in offering
	high-quality programming, and it continues to invest in a diverse roster of programming and make its programming available to consumers on a variety of devices and platforms to enhance the appeal of its products and services.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In the U.S., Home Box Office&#146;s programming and services are distributed in several different ways. HBO and Cinemax
	programming is available to subscribers of traditional affiliates for viewing live and on demand on television and various Internet-connected devices. In addition, to reach households that do not subscribe to multichannel video services provided by
	traditional affiliates (&#147;traditional MVPD services&#148;), Home Box Office operates HBO NOW, a domestic stand-alone OTT service that is distributed by digital distributors, such as Apple, Google, Amazon and Roku, as well as by some affiliates.
	Home Box Office has also entered into arrangements with a number of digital distributors to provide their subscribers access to HBO and Cinemax services and programming on a variety of digital platforms and devices, and continues to explore
	additional distribution platforms while investing in technology to add features and enhance the overall consumer experience on its OTT services. Home Box Office also sells its original programming in both physical and digital formats and licenses
	some of its library programming to the Amazon Prime SVOD service.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Internationally, Home Box Office tailors the
	distribution of its programming for each territory using one or more of the following distribution models: premium pay and basic tier television services distributed by traditional affiliates, licensing of programming to third-party providers, OTT
	services distributed by third parties and direct-to-consumer OTT services. HBO- and Cinemax-branded premium pay, basic tier television and OTT services are distributed in over 60 countries in Latin America, Europe and Asia. Home Box Office&#146;s
	original programming is also available to consumers in over 150 countries, both via licenses to international television networks and OTT services and through sales of programming in physical and digital formats.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Home Box Office Programming
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Domestic Original
	Programming
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Home Box Office continues to invest in high-quality original programming for HBO and Cinemax.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	HBO&#146;s original programming features award-winning and critically acclaimed dramatic and comedy series, such as
<I>
	Game of
	Thrones
</I>
	,
<I>
	&nbsp;Girls
</I>
	,
<I>
	Silicon Valley
</I>
	,
<I>
	&nbsp;Veep
</I>
	and
<I>
	Westworld
</I>
	,&nbsp;as well as talk shows and political satire, such as
<I>
	Last Week Tonight with John Oliver
</I>
	and
<I>
	Real Time with Bill Maher
</I>
	, HBO films, such as
<I>
	All The Way
</I>
	and
<I>
	Confirmation
</I>
	, mini-series, such as
<I>
	The Night Of
</I>
	, boxing matches and other sports programming, documentaries, such as
<I>
	A Girl in the River: The Price of Forgiveness
</I>
	and
<I>
	Everything is Copy
</I>
	, and comedy
	and music specials. The quality and diversity of HBO&#146;s original
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	7
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	programming differentiates HBO from other premium pay television services, basic television networks and OTT services, while enhancing the value of the HBO brand both domestically and
	internationally. This programming also continues to build the value of Home Box Office&#146;s content library while increasing the value of HBO across its businesses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Home Box Office continues to expand HBO&#146;s roster of original series. In 2016, Home Box Office premiered seven new series:
<I>
	Animals.
</I>
	,
<I>
	Divorce
</I>
	,
<I>
	High Maintenance
</I>
	,
<I>
	Insecure
</I>
	,
<I>
	VICE News Tonight
</I>
	,
<I>
	Vice Principals
</I>
	and
<I>
	Westworld
</I>
	. In 2017, Home Box Office has premiered
<I>
	The Young Pope
</I>
	(a limited series starring Jude Law and
	Diane Keaton) and
<I>
	Big Little Lies
</I>
	(a limited series starring Reese Witherspoon, Nicole Kidman and Shailene Woodley) and plans to premiere additional new series, including
<I>
	The Deuce
</I>
	(starring James Franco and Maggie Gyllenhaal). Home
	Box Office has also worked closely with Warner Bros. on original programming such as
<I>
	Westworld
</I>
	and
<I>
	The Leftovers
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2016, Home Box Office received 22 Primetime Emmy Awards, the most of any network for the 15th year in a row, with
<I>
	Game
	of Thrones
</I>
	winning 12 awards. In 2016, Home Box Office also won the Academy Award for Best Documentary Short (
<I>
	A Girl in the River: the Price of Forgiveness
</I>
	), a Golden Globe Award (
<I>
	Show Me a Hero
</I>
	), six George Foster Peabody Awards,
	five Sports Emmy Awards and three News&nbsp;&amp; Documentary Emmy Awards.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Cinemax&#146;s original primetime series in
	2016 included
<I>
	Banshee, Outcast
</I>
	and
<I>
	Quarry
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Domestic Licensed Programming
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Domestically, a significant portion of the programming on HBO and Cinemax consists of uncut and uncensored feature films,
	including recently-released feature films. Home Box Office has long-term licensing agreements with major film studios and independent producers and distributors, including Warner Bros., Twentieth Century Fox (&#147;Fox&#148;), Universal Pictures
	(&#147;Universal&#148;) and Summit Entertainment. The agreements provide Home Box Office the exclusive right during the applicable license period to exhibit and distribute on its premium pay television and OTT services the entire feature film slate
	theatrically released in the U.S. by these studios during specified release years (other than certain animated films and certain other specified films).&nbsp;A majority of these agreements cover theatrical film slates through release year 2021 or
	beyond. Half of the top eighty feature films theatrically released in 2016 (as determined based on domestic box office receipts) will be exhibited exclusively on the HBO and Cinemax premium pay television and OTT services during the applicable
	license periods. Home Box Office also has agreements to license older films with Fox, Universal, Warner Bros. and a number of other major studios and independent distributors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	International Programming
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	A substantial portion of the programming on Home Box Office&#146;s international premium pay, basic tier television and OTT
	services consists of feature films licensed from major studios in the U.S. and domestic HBO- and Cinemax-branded original programming. Home Box Office also has agreements to license older films from a number of major U.S. studios and other domestic
	and international independent distributors. In addition to films, Home Box Office&#146;s international content offerings may feature local language original programming and/or U.S. television programming produced by other production studios.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Home Box Office&#146;s Businesses and Revenues
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Domestic Premium Pay Television and OTT Services
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Home Box Office generates revenues principally from licensing its programming to affiliates and digital distributors that have
	contracted to receive and distribute the programming to their customers who subscribe to the HBO and Cinemax services. At December&nbsp;31, 2016, Home Box Office had approximately 49&nbsp;million domestic subscribers, including subscribers to
	HBO&#146;s OTT service, and HBO was the most widely distributed domestic multi-channel premium pay television service.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Home Box Office&#146;s license agreements with affiliates are typically long-term arrangements that provide for annual service
	fee increases and marketing support. The relationship between subscriber totals and the amount of revenues earned under Home Box Office&#146;s license agreements depends on the specific terms of the applicable agreement, which may include basic
	and/or pay television subscriber thresholds, volume discounts and other performance-based discounts. Marketing and promotional activities intended to retain existing subscribers and acquire new subscribers may also impact revenue earned.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	8
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Home Box Office has entered into arrangements with a number of digital distributors to distribute HBO NOW and/or provide their subscribers access to the HBO and Cinemax services and programming
	on a variety of digital platforms and devices, and Home Box Office is continuing to expand the number of digital distribution partners.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Subscribers of traditional affiliates can view HBO and Cinemax programming on an HBO or Cinemax multiplex television channel
	as well as through on-demand products, HBO On Demand, Cinemax On Demand, HBO GO and MAX GO. HBO NOW, HBO GO and MAX GO offer nearly all seasons of HBO&#146;s and Cinemax&#146;s original series, respectively, as well as feature films, HBO mini-series
	and films, sports programming, documentaries, comedy and music specials, bonus features and behind-the-scenes extras.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	International Premium Pay, Basic
	Tier Television and OTT Services
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Unique, country-specific HBO- and Cinemax-branded premium pay, basic tier television
	and OTT services are distributed in more than 60 countries in Latin America, Europe and Asia. In Europe and Asia, Home Box Office operates through consolidated, wholly-owned subsidiaries. In Latin America, Home Box Office operates through an
	unconsolidated joint venture. Home Box Office had approximately 85&nbsp;million international premium pay, basic tier television service and OTT service subscribers at December&nbsp;31, 2016, including subscribers through Home Box Office&#146;s
	unconsolidated joint ventures. HBO GO was available to HBO premium pay television subscribers in over 30 countries and territories at December&nbsp;31, 2016, and Home Box Office plans to make HBO GO available to HBO premium pay television
	subscribers in additional countries and territories in 2017. Home Box Office generates revenues primarily from licensing its programming to international affiliates. The terms of Home Box Office&#146;s agreements with its international affiliates
	vary from country to country, and the amount of revenues attributable to such agreements can be based on a number of factors such as basic and/or pay television subscriber thresholds, performance-based or volume discounts, negotiated minimum
	guarantees or flat-fee arrangements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Home Box Office operates OTT services in the Nordic region and Spain (launched in
	November 2016). In addition, HBO Latin America (Home Box Office&#146;s largest joint venture) provides OTT services in Colombia, Mexico, Brazil (launched in December 2016) and Argentina (launched in December 2016). Home Box Office expects to expand
	the distribution of OTT services to additional territories around the world.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Home Entertainment and Content Licensing
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Home Box Office also generates revenues from the exploitation of its original programming through multiple other distribution
	outlets. Home Box Office sells its original programming in both physical and digital formats in the U.S. and various international regions through a wide variety of digital storefronts and traditional retailers. Significant home entertainment
	releases in 2016 included
<I>
	Game of Thrones: The Complete Fifth Season
</I>
	,
<I>
	Game of Thrones: The Complete Sixth Season
</I>
	,
<I>
	Silicon Valley: The Complete Second Season
</I>
	and
<I>
	Veep: The Complete Fourth Season
</I>
	.&nbsp;In addition, Home Box
	Office also licenses some of its library programming to the Amazon Prime SVOD service. Finally, Home Box Office has also licensed some of its original programming, such as
<I>
	Sex and the City
</I>
	, as well as
<I>
	Everybody Loves Raymond
</I>
	, which was
	produced by Home Box Office but originally aired on broadcast television, to domestic basic cable networks and local television stations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Home Box Office licenses both individual programs and packages of programs to television networks and OTT services in over 150
	countries, including arrangements under which it licenses programming to television networks that are branded as the &#147;Home of HBO&#148; in countries such as the U.K., Australia, France, Germany and Israel and as &#147;HBO Canada&#148; in
	Canada. In 2016, Home Box Office expanded its agreement with Sky Television, which provides Sky Atlantic exclusive rights to air HBO programming in Austria, Germany, Ireland, Italy and the U.K. until 2020.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	WARNER BROS.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Warner Bros. is the largest television and film studio in the world based on total television and film revenues as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2016. Its businesses consist principally of the production, distribution and licensing of television programming and feature films and the distribution of home entertainment product in both physical and digital formats, as well as
	the production and distribution of videogames and consumer product and brand licensing. In recent years, Warner Bros. has
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	9
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	increased its production of new forms of content, including short-form online and mobile content, and has launched new direct-to-consumer offerings, such as OTT services. Warner Bros.&#146;
	businesses benefit from a shared infrastructure, including shared production, distribution, marketing and administrative functions and resources.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Warner Bros. is the #1 producer of primetime television series for the U.S. broadcast networks for the 2016-2017 television
	season, producing over 30 series, a position it has held for each of the past eight television seasons.&nbsp;Warner Bros. has at least four series, including at least one new series, on each of the five broadcast networks. Overall, Warner Bros. is
	producing 75 television series in the U.S. for the 2016-2017 television season.&nbsp;In addition, Warner Bros. licenses its U.S. programming in over 190 countries at December&nbsp;31, 2016. Warner Bros. is expanding and diversifying the genres and
	types of television programming it produces as well as the buyers of its programming domestically, and is expanding its international television production business through its global network of local production companies in 16 international
	territories.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Warner Bros.&#146; films generated almost $5 billion at the global box office, and Warner Bros. was the #2
	film studio in global box office receipts in 2016. Warner Bros. has been the #1 or #2 film studio in domestic box office receipts for eight of the past 10 years and the #1 or #2 film studio in global box office receipts for nine of the past 10
	years. Warner Bros. has exceeded $4 billion in global box office receipts for seven of the past eight years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Warner Bros.
	is the largest videogame publisher among television and film studios, built on key brands and franchises. Warner Bros. plans to expand its production of videogames for consoles and mobile devices using its portfolio of videogame production studios
	and strong global brands and franchises.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Warner Bros. is focused on increasing the digital sales and rentals of its film
	and television content and is a leader in a variety of initiatives designed to make digital ownership more compelling for consumers. Warner Bros. has led the U.S. home entertainment industry in sales of home entertainment products for 15 years. At
	December&nbsp;31, 2016, Warner Bros.&#146; vast content library consists of more than 80,000 hours of programming, including over 7,000 feature films and 5,000 television programs comprised of tens of thousands of individual episodes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Warner Bros.&#146; portfolio of leading brands includes DC Entertainment&#146;s brands (DC Comics, Vertigo and MAD Magazine)
	as well as the Looney Tunes and Hanna-Barbera brands. DC Comics&#146; characters include such iconic characters as Batman, the Flash, Green Arrow, Superman and Wonder Woman, while Warner Bros.&#146; other characters include Bugs Bunny, Harry Potter,
	Scooby-Doo and Tom and Jerry, among many others. Warner Bros. is focused on expanding its brands and characters across all its businesses, including film, television programming, videogames and consumer products.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Warner Bros. has developed strong global franchise properties from its brands and featuring its characters, including film
	franchises such as the
<I>
	Batman
</I>
	and
<I>
	Harry Potter
</I>
	series and
<I>
	The Hobbit
</I>
	and
<I>
	The Lord of the Rings
</I>
	trilogies, and it is focused on extending its existing global film franchises.&nbsp;Warner Bros. released two films based on
	DC Entertainment characters in 2016 (
<I>
	Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
</I>
	and
<I>
	Suicide Squad
</I>
	) and plans to release several additional films based on DC Entertainment characters, including
<I>
	Justice League
</I>
	and
<I>
	Wonder Woman
</I>
	in
	2017 and
<I>
	Aquaman
</I>
	in 2018. Warner Bros. also released
<I>
	Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
</I>
	in 2016, the first of five films in partnership with J.K. Rowling based on J.K. Rowling&#146;s Wizarding World.&nbsp;In February 2017, Warner
	Bros. released
<I>
	The LEGO Batman Movie
</I>
	. Warner Bros. has also developed a successful slate of horror films and plans to release the next installment in
<I>
	The Conjuring
</I>
	franchise (
<I>
	Annabelle&nbsp;2
</I>
	) in 2017. Warner Bros. is also
	focused on creating new global film franchises and plans to release
<I>
	Kong: Skull Island
</I>
	and
<I>
	King Arthur
</I>
	in 2017,
<I>
	Ready Player One
</I>
	in 2018 and
<I>
	Minecraft
</I>
	in 2019.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In television, 10 series based on DC Entertainment characters (including
<I>
	Arrow
</I>
	,
<I>
	DC&#146;s Legends of Tomorrow
</I>
	,
<I>
	The Flash, iZombie
</I>
	,
<I>
	Lucifer
</I>
	,
<I>
	Gotham
</I>
	and
<I>
	Supergirl
</I>
	) are airing on broadcast and cable television during the 2016-2017 television season. Warner Bros. is also producing three new series based on Warner Bros. theatrical
	titles (
<I>
	Lethal Weapon
</I>
	,
<I>
	Frequency
</I>
	and
<I>
	Training Day
</I>
	) for the 2016-2017 television season.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2016,
	Warner Bros. formed Warner Bros. Digital Networks, a division focused on taking advantage of the changes in the TV ecosystem, consumer viewing patterns and technology. The division includes DramaFever (acquired by Warner Bros. in 2016), which owns
	and operates an OTT service in the U.S. that specializes in Korean dramas. DramaFever has both the technology platform and direct consumer expertise that will enable Warner Bros. to build, launch and operate a portfolio of
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	10
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage12"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	OTT service offerings. Warner Bros. Digital Networks also oversees Machinima (acquired by Warner Bros. in 2016), a global aggregator of gaming, superhero and fandom-generated content. Warner
	Bros. Digital Networks manages Warner Bros.&#146; investments in Uninterrupted, a partnership with LeBron James and Turner Sports focused on developing and distributing an original production slate across multiple platforms, and the Ellen Digital
	Network, a partnership with Ellen DeGeneres focused on digital content and social games. In addition, Warner Bros. has ownership interests in two SVOD services that operate outside the United States.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Television
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Warner Bros.
	is a leader in the global television production and distribution business. Warner Bros. is focused on maintaining its leadership position in producing primetime series for the U.S. broadcast networks (including The CW broadcast network (&#147;The
	CW&#148;)) while increasing production of high-quality original series for basic cable networks (including expanding its collaboration with Turner), premium pay television services (including HBO) and OTT services. Warner Bros. is also expanding its
	international local television production business by using its global network of local production companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Warner
	Bros. is actively collaborating with Turner to significantly expand their global kids businesses and maximize the related consumer product opportunities. This collaboration is intended to drive the success of Cartoon Network and Boomerang and foster
	broader global exposure for Warner Bros.&#146; existing brands and franchises while also helping launch new global franchises and increase consumer product sales. Warner Bros. is producing original animated programming based on its characters and
	brands for Turner&#146;s Cartoon Network and Boomerang network and Warner Bros. and Turner are jointly producing original animated programming such as
<I>
	New Looney Tunes
</I>
	,
<I>
	Be Cool, Scooby Doo!
</I>
	and
<I>
	The Tom and Jerry Show
</I>
	. Warner
	Bros. and Turner are also producing and distributing content for DC Super Hero Girls, a franchise centered on iconic female DC Entertainment characters.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Domestic Business
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Warner Bros. produces and distributes its television programming for initial airing on broadcast and basic cable television
	networks, premium pay television and OTT services and local television stations in the U.S. Warner Bros. also produces and distributes short-form live-action series and animated programming for initial viewing on digital platforms. Warner
	Bros.&#146; programming includes the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	reality-based non-scripted television series produced by Warner Horizon Television Inc., including
<I>
	The
	Bachelor
</I>
	,
<I>
	Bachelor in Paradise, The Bachelorette, First Dates
</I>
	,

</I>
