	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TIME WARNER INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION - (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In addition, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, Selling, general and
	administrative expenses included approximately $40 million of costs related to the AT&amp;T merger. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, Selling, general and administrative expenses also included a $22 million foreign currency charge related
	to the remeasurement of the Company&#146;s net monetary assets denominated in Venezuelan currency resulting from a change in the foreign exchange rate used by the Company from the SICAD 2 exchange rate to the Simadi exchange rate. For the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, Selling, general and administrative expenses also included a $173 million foreign currency charge related to the remeasurement of the Company&#146;s net monetary assets denominated in Venezuelan currency resulting from a
	change in the foreign currency exchange rate used by the Company from the official rate to the SICAD 2 exchange rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Included in Costs of revenues and Selling, general and administrative expenses was depreciation expense of $479 million, $492
	million and $531 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Amortization
	Expense.
</I>
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization expense was $190 million, $189 million and $202 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<I>
</I>
<B>

	Restructuring and Severance Costs
</I>
</B>
<I>
	.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For the years ended December&nbsp;31,
	2016, 2015 and 2014, the Company incurred Restructuring and severance costs primarily related to employee terminations and other exit activities. Restructuring and severance costs are as follows (millions):
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The total number of employees terminated across the segments for the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014 was approximately 800, 700 and 4,000, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Operating
	Income.
</I>
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating Income was $7.547 billion, $6.865 billion and $5.975 billion for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Excluding the items noted under &#147;Transactions and Other Items
	Affecting Comparability&#148; totaling $54 million of expense, $58 million of expense and $142 million of income for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively, Operating Income increased $678 million and $1.090 billion in
	2016 and 2015, respectively. Operating Income increased in 2016, despite the unfavorable impact of foreign currency exchange rates of approximately $140 million, primarily reflecting increases at all of the segments, partially offset by a decrease
	at Corporate. Operating Income increased in 2015, despite the unfavorable impact of foreign currency exchange rates of approximately $480 million, reflecting increases at all of the segments and Corporate. The segment variations are discussed under
	&#147;Business Segment Results.&#148; If the foreign exchange rates relative to the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar remain at the levels they were at as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 or if the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar strengthens further in 2017 relative to the foreign
	currencies to which the Company is exposed, the Company&#146;s Operating Income will be negatively affected.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TIME WARNER INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION - (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in interest expense for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016
	was primarily due to higher average debt balances, partially offset by lower average interest rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in
	interest expense for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to higher average debt balances, partially offset by lower average interest rates. The increase in interest income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily
	related to noncash interest income accretion related to the transactions with CME that were completed in 2014, partially offset by the recognition of interest income during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 on a note receivable that was
	collected in March 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>

	table below (millions):

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Investment gains (losses), net, amounts related to the separation or disposition of former
	Time Warner segments and premiums paid and costs incurred on debt redemption are discussed under &#147;Transactions and Other Items Affecting Comparability.&#148; For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, the increase in loss from equity method
	investees was mainly due to the Company&#146;s share of losses from CME of $198 million primarily related to the CME financing transactions in 2016. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, loss from equity method investees decreased despite the
	unfavorable impact of foreign exchange rates of approximately $70 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Income Tax Provision.
</I>
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income tax provision was $1.281 billion, $1.651 billion and $785
	million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The Company&#146;s effective tax rate was 25%, 30% and 17% for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The decrease in the effective tax
	rate in 2016 as compared to 2015 was primarily due to a change in the Company&#146;s tax method of accounting for film and television cost amortization that was approved by the Internal Revenue Service during the third quarter of 2016.&nbsp;The
	change in method generated a tax benefit related to extra-territorial income exclusions for tax years dating back to 2001. The increase in the effective tax rate in 2015 as compared to 2014 was primarily due to the recognition of a tax benefit
	attributable to the reversal of tax reserves in connection with a Federal tax settlement in 2014. In addition, the 2015 effective tax rate benefited from a higher percentage of earnings from non-U.S. entities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Income from Continuing Operations.
</I>
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income from continuing operations was $3.914 billion,
	$3.795 billion and $3.894 billion for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Excluding the items noted under &#147;Transactions and Other Items Affecting Comparability&#148; totaling $726 million of expense, $148
	million of expense and $234 million of income for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively, Income from continuing operations increased $697 million and $283 million in 2016 and 2015, respectively. The increase in 2016 as
	compared to 2015 reflected higher Operating Income and lower income tax expense, partially offset by higher Other loss, net. The increase in 2015 as compared to 2014 reflected higher Operating Income, partially offset by higher income tax expense.
	Basic and diluted income per common share from continuing operations attributable to Time Warner Inc. common shareholders were $5.00 and $4.94, respectively, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, $4.64 and $4.58, respectively, for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and $4.49 and $4.41, respectively, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	54
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TIME WARNER INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION - (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Discontinued Operations, Net of
	Tax.
</I>
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Discontinued operations, net of tax was $11 million of income, $37 million of income and $67 million of loss for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Basic and diluted income per
	common share from discontinued operations attributable to Time Warner Inc. common shareholders were $0.01 and $0.02, respectively, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. Basic and diluted income per common share from discontinued operations
	attributable to Time Warner Inc. common shareholders were $0.05 and $0.04, respectively, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Both basic and diluted loss per common share from discontinued operations attributable to Time Warner Inc. common
	shareholders were $0.07 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Net Income Attributable to Time Warner Inc.
	Shareholders.
</I>
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net income attributable to Time Warner Inc. shareholders was $3.926 billion, $3.833 billion and $3.827 billion for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Basic and Diluted
	net income per common share attributable to Time Warner Inc. common shareholders were $5.01 and $4.96, respectively, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, $4.69 and $4.62, respectively, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and $4.42 and
	$4.34, respectively, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>

	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Costs of revenues and Selling, general and administrative expenses exclude depreciation.

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;WIDTH:26%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Costs of revenues exclude depreciation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	2016 vs. 2015
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Domestic subscription revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 increased $627 million, primarily due to higher
	contractual rates, partially offset by a decrease in subscribers. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, international subscription revenues increased $3 million as growth, mainly in Latin America, was partially offset by the unfavorable impact
	of foreign exchange rates of approximately $75 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, the increase in
	Advertising revenues reflected domestic growth of $158 million primarily driven by Turner&#146;s news business, mainly due to the 2016 U.S. Presidential election coverage, and sports programming, including the 2016 NCAA Tournament, partially offset
	by lower audience delivery at certain entertainment networks. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, international advertising revenues decreased $32 million as growth, mainly in Latin America, was offset by the unfavorable impact of foreign
	exchange rates of approximately $50 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, programming costs increased
	mainly due to higher costs for sports programming, the 2016 U.S. Presidential election coverage, syndicated series and acquired films, partially offset by lower costs for original series. Included in programming costs for the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015 were programming impairment charges of $136 million and $131 million, respectively, related to Turner&#146;s decision to no longer air certain programming. The Company expects that the rate of growth for programming
	costs will be higher for the first half of 2017 as compared with the same period in the prior year principally due to certain sports programming. The increase in other direct operating costs for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 primarily
	related to costs associated with Turner&#146;s and Warner Bros.&#146; strategic partnership to grow their global kids businesses and digital initiatives.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, Selling, general and administrative expenses increased reflecting higher marketing
	expense of $104 million primarily for new original series as well as higher costs related to employee compensation and benefits.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Refer to &#147;Transactions and Other Items Affecting Comparability&#148; for a discussion of Gain (loss) on operating assets,
	Asset impairments, Venezuelan foreign currency loss, costs related to the AT&amp;T merger and external costs related to mergers, acquisitions and dispositions for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, which affected the comparability of
	the Turner segment&#146;s results.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Operating Income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 increased driven by higher
	Revenues, partially offset by higher Costs of revenues and Selling, general and administrative expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	56
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage58"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TIME WARNER INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION - (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	2015 vs. 2014
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in Subscription revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 reflected higher domestic revenues of $142
	million primarily due to higher rates, partially offset by lower subscribers, and lower international revenues of $99 million due to the unfavorable impact of foreign exchange rates of approximately $185 million, partially offset by growth mainly in
	Latin America.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in Advertising revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 reflected domestic growth
	of $116 million, mainly driven by Turner&#146;s domestic news business and the 2015 NCAA Tournament, partially offset by lower audience delivery at certain of its entertainment networks and the absence of Advertising revenues in 2015 associated with
	NASCAR television programming. International advertising revenues decreased $47 million as growth was more than offset by the unfavorable impact of foreign exchange rates of approximately $125 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in Content and other revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to higher license fees
	from SVOD services.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, Costs of revenues decreased primarily due to lower
	programming impairment charges. Programming impairment charges related to Turner&#146;s decision to no longer air certain programming were $131 million and $526 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Excluding the
	programming impairment charges, programming costs declined primarily due to lower acquired films and syndicated series costs as a result of the abandonment of certain programming in 2014 and the absence of costs in 2015 associated with NASCAR,
	partially offset by higher costs associated with airing the Major League Baseball playoffs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, Selling, general and administrative expenses decreased primarily due to operational efficiency initiatives, including the 2014 restructuring activities described below and lower marketing expenses of $50 million, partially
	offset by the absence in the current period of the reversal in 2014 of a $20 million accrued contingency.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Refer to
	&#147;Transactions and Other Items Affecting Comparability&#148; for a discussion of Asset impairments, Gain on operating assets, Venezuelan foreign currency loss and external costs related to mergers, acquisitions and dispositions for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, which affected the comparability of the Turner segment&#146;s results.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The results
	for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 included Restructuring and severance costs of $58 million and $249 million, respectively, primarily related to headcount reductions in connection with restructuring activities designed to position
	the Company for the current operating environment and reallocate resources to the Company&#146;s growth initiatives.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The
	increase in Operating Income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to lower Costs of revenues, higher Revenues, lower Restructuring and severance costs, a decrease in Venezuela foreign currency losses and lower Selling, general
	and administrative expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	57
</P>

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;WIDTH:26%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Costs of revenues exclude depreciation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	2016 vs. 2015
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, the increase in Subscription revenues was primarily due to higher domestic
	contractual rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in originals and sports programming costs for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 was
	primarily due to higher original programming expenses associated with new series, partially offset by the impact of the change in the estimate of the utilization period of the Home Box Office segment&#146;s original programming described below. The
	increase in acquired films and syndicated series programming costs for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 reflects increases for both HBO&#146;s domestic and international businesses. The increase in other direct operating costs for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 was mainly due to costs associated with HBO&#146;s OTT service.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During the second quarter of
	2016, the Home Box Office segment revised its estimate of the period over which its original programming is utilized by its subscribers.&nbsp;The updated estimate gives consideration to Home Box Office&#146;s original programming history and was
	driven by consumer viewing patterns, which are influenced by the increased availability of and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	58
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage60"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TIME WARNER INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION - (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	on-demand access to Home Box Office&#146;s content across a wide variety of devices and services, including HBO&#146;s OTT service, which launched in April 2015.&nbsp;As a result, in determining
	amortization under the film forecast computation method, the weighted average subscriber utilization period for the majority of Home Box Office&#146;s original programming was increased by approximately five months.&nbsp;This change resulted in a
	reduction of amortization expense, as compared to the amount determined using Home Box Office&#146;s previous estimate, of approximately $150 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, Selling, general and administrative expenses increased primarily due to $13 million
	of higher employee-related costs and $9 million of expenses related to Home Box Office&#146;s withdrawal from a multiemployer benefit plan, partially offset by lower marketing expenses of $15 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Refer to &#147;Transactions and Other Items Affecting Comparability&#148; for a discussion of costs related to the AT&amp;T
	merger for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, which affected the comparability of the Home Box Office segment&#146;s results.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The results for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 included $49 million of Restructuring and severance costs principally
	related to executive severance costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in Operating Income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 was
	primarily due to higher Revenues, partially offset by higher Costs of revenues and higher Restructuring and severance costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	2015 vs. 2014
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in Subscription revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to higher
	domestic subscription revenues of $195 million driven mainly by higher contractual rates. International subscription revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 decreased $25 million mainly due to the transfer to Turner of the operation and
	certain contracts of an HBO-branded basic tier television service in India and the unfavorable impact of foreign exchange rates of approximately $15 million, partially offset by growth from international subscribers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in Content and other revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to higher television
	licensing revenues from original programming of $91 million, which included the negative impact of foreign exchange rates of approximately $15 million, partially offset by lower home entertainment revenues of $62 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in Costs of revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 reflected higher originals and sports programming
	costs and higher other direct operating costs. The increase in originals and sports programming costs for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to higher programming impairments and higher costs for original series. The increase in
	other direct operating costs for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was mainly due to costs associated with HBO&#146;s OTT service.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, Selling, general and administrative expenses increased primarily due to higher
	marketing expenses related to HBO&#146;s OTT service.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Refer to &#147;Transactions and Other Items Affecting
	Comparability&#148; for a discussion of Asset impairments for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, which affected the comparability of the Home Box Office segment&#146;s results.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in Operating Income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to higher revenues and lower
	Restructuring and severance costs, partially offset by higher Costs of revenues and Selling, general and administrative expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	59
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage61"></A>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TIME WARNER INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION - (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Warner Bros.
</I>
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenues and Operating Income of the
	Warner Bros. segment for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014 are as follows (millions):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Costs of revenues and Selling, general and administrative expenses exclude depreciation.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Revenues primarily relate to theatrical product (which is content made available for initial exhibition in theaters) and
	television product (which is content made available for initial airing on television or OTT services). The components of Revenues for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014 are as follows (millions):

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;WIDTH:26%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Costs of revenues exclude depreciation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	2016 vs. 2015
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in Revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 included the net unfavorable impact of foreign exchange
	rates of approximately $195 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Theatrical product revenues from film rentals increased for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2016, reflecting higher revenues of $935 million from theatrical films released during 2016 compared to 2015, partially offset by lower carryover revenues of $333 million from prior period releases. The Company released 19 and 24
	theatrical films in 2016 and 2015, respectively. Although there were fewer releases, the 2016 film slate, which included films such as
<I>
	Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
</I>
	,
<I>
	Suicide Squad
</I>
	and
<I>
	Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find
	Them
</I>
	, generated higher revenues than the 2015 film slate, which included films such as
<I>
	San Andreas
</I>
	and
<I>
	Mad Max: Fury Road
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, theatrical product revenues from home video and electronic delivery continued to
	decline primarily due to lower revenues from releases during 2016 compared to 2015. There were 22 and 24 home video and electronic delivery releases in 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in theatrical product revenues from television licensing for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 was primarily
	due to higher international license fees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in theatrical product revenues from consumer products and other
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 was primarily due to higher consumer products licensing for theatrical films released in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in television product revenues from television licensing for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 was primarily
	due to higher initial telecast revenues, reflecting an increase in the number of episodes delivered.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The decrease in
	television product revenues from home video and electronic delivery for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 was primarily due to continued declines in sales of home entertainment product in physical formats.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Videogames and other revenues decreased for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 primarily due to lower revenues from
	videogames released during 2016 compared to 2015. The Company released 12 and 14 videogames in 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Included in film and television production costs are production costs related to videogames, as well as theatrical film and
	videogame valuation adjustments resulting primarily from revisions to estimates of ultimate revenue and/or costs for certain theatrical films and videogames. Theatrical film valuation adjustments for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015
	were $69 million and $80 million, respectively. Videogame valuation adjustments for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015 were $20 million and $17 million, respectively. The increase in film and television production costs for the
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	61
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage63"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TIME WARNER INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION - (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 was primarily due to higher costs for television and theatrical product, partially offset by lower costs for videogames. The decrease in print and advertising
	costs for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 was primarily due to the type and number of videogame releases. Other costs, including merchandise and related costs, decreased for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 primarily due to lower
	distribution-related costs of sales, largely as a result of lower revenues for videogames and home entertainment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Selling, general and administrative expenses decreased for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 mainly due to lower bad debt
	expense.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Refer to &#147;Transactions and Other Items Affecting Comparability&#148; for a discussion of Gain (loss) on
	operating assets, Asset impairments, Venezuelan foreign currency loss, costs related to the AT&amp;T merger and external costs related to mergers, acquisitions and dispositions for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, which affected the
	comparability of the Warner Bros. segment&#146;s results.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in Operating Income for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 was primarily due to lower Costs of revenues, a Gain on operating assets, higher Revenues and lower Selling, general and administrative expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	2015 vs. 2014
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in Revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 included the net unfavorable impact of foreign exchange
	rates of approximately $685 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Theatrical product revenues from film rentals decreased for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, reflecting lower revenues of $560 million from theatrical films released during 2015 compared to 2014, partially offset by higher carryover revenues of $169 million from prior period releases. The Company released 24 and 22
	theatrical films in 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, theatrical product revenues
	from home video and electronic delivery decreased primarily due to lower revenues from prior period releases, including catalog titles. There were 24 and 18 home video and electronic delivery releases in 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The decrease in theatrical product revenues from television licensing for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily
	due to the timing and mix of availabilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Television product revenues from television licensing for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 increased due to higher syndication revenues (including higher license fees from SVOD services), partially offset by lower initial telecast revenues.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The decrease in television product revenues from home video and electronic delivery for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
	was primarily due to continued declines in sales of home entertainment product in physical formats, partially offset by growth in EST.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Television product revenues from consumer products and other increased for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 primarily due
	to an increase in the production of television series by Warner Bros. on behalf of third parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Videogames and other
	revenues increased for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 primarily due to higher revenues of $706 million from videogames released during 2015 compared to 2014, partially offset by lower carryover revenues of $54 million from prior period
	releases. The Company released 14 and eight videogames in 2015 and 2014, respectively. In addition, the increase in videogames and other revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was partially offset by lower patent license revenues.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	62
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TIME WARNER INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION - (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Included in film and television production costs are production costs related
	to videogames, as well as theatrical film and videogame valuation adjustments resulting primarily from revisions to estimates of ultimate revenue and/or costs for certain theatrical films and videogames. Theatrical film valuation adjustments for the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 were $80 million and $86 million, respectively. Videogame valuation adjustments for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 were $17 million and $51 million, respectively. The increase in film and
	television production costs and print and advertising costs for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to the mix of product released. Other costs, including merchandise and related costs increased for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 primarily due to higher distribution costs associated with videogame sales.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Selling, general and
	administrative expenses decreased for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 primarily due to the favorable impact of foreign exchange rates of approximately $80 million, lower distribution expenses of $23 million and lower employee expenses of $18
	million, partially offset by higher bad debt expense of $80 million primarily related to international television operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Refer to &#147;Transactions and Other Items Affecting Comparability&#148; for a discussion of Asset impairments, Gain (loss)
	on operating assets, Venezuelan foreign currency loss and external costs related to mergers, acquisitions and dispositions for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, which affected the comparability of the Warner Bros. segment&#146;s
	results.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The increase in Operating Income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to higher revenues,
	lower Restructuring and severance costs, lower Selling, general and administrative expenses, lower Asset impairments and lower Venezuelan foreign currency losses, partially offset by higher Costs of revenues.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Corporate.
</I>
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating Loss at Corporate for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015
	and 2014 was as follows (millions):

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;WIDTH:26%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling, general and administrative expenses exclude depreciation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	2016 vs. 2015
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Refer to &#147;Transactions and Other Items Affecting Comparability&#148; for a discussion of Asset impairments, pension
	settlements, costs related to the AT&amp;T merger and external costs related to mergers, acquisitions and dispositions for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, which affected the comparability of Corporate&#146;s results.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, Operating loss increased primarily due to higher equity-based compensation expense
	of $69 million, which mainly reflected higher expenses for performance stock units due to an increase in the Company&#146;s stock price, $28 million of costs related to the AT&amp;T merger, $24 million of pension settlement charges and higher costs
	of $14 million primarily related to technology initiatives.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	63
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage65"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TIME WARNER INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION - (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	2015 vs. 2014
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Refer to &#147;Transactions and Other Items Affecting Comparability&#148; for a discussion of Asset impairments, Gain on
	operating assets and external costs related to mergers, acquisitions and dispositions for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, which affected the comparability of Corporate&#146;s results.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Excluding the $441 million Gain on Operating assets during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, Operating Loss for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 decreased primarily due to lower external costs related to mergers, acquisitions and dispositions of $46 million, lower equity-based compensation expense of $46 million, which mainly reflected lower expenses for
	performance stock units due to a decrease in the Company&#146;s stock price, lower Restructuring and severance costs as well as lower costs related to enterprise efficiency initiatives. The enterprise efficiency initiatives involve the
	centralization of certain administrative functions to generate cost savings or other benefits for the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Selling,
	general and administrative expenses included costs related to enterprise efficiency initiatives of $27 million and $43 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	FINANCIAL CONDITION AND LIQUIDITY
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Management believes that cash generated by or available to the Company should be sufficient to fund its capital and liquidity
	needs for the foreseeable future, including scheduled debt repayments and quarterly dividend payments. Time Warner&#146;s sources of cash include Cash provided by operations, Cash and equivalents on hand, available borrowing capacity under its
	committed credit facilities and commercial paper program and access to capital markets. Time Warner&#146;s unused committed capacity at December&nbsp;31, 2016 was $5.162 billion, which included $1.539 billion of Cash and equivalents.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Current Financial Condition
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2016, Time Warner had $24.339 billion of debt and $1.539 billion of Cash and equivalents, resulting in
	net debt of $22.800 billion, compared to $23.792 billion of debt and $2.155 billion of Cash and equivalents, resulting in net debt of $21.637 billion, at December&nbsp;31, 2015. Total equity was $24.337 billion and $23.619 billion at
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The following table shows the significant items contributing to the
	increase in net debt from December&nbsp;31, 2015 to December&nbsp;31, 2016 (millions):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TIME WARNER INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION - (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In January 2016, Time Warner&#146;s Board of Directors authorized up to $5.0
	billion of share repurchases beginning January&nbsp;1, 2016, including the amount remaining at December&nbsp;31, 2015 under the prior authorization.&nbsp;Purchases under the stock repurchase program may be made on the open market or in privately
	negotiated transactions, with the size and timing of purchases based on a number of factors, including price and business and market conditions. From January&nbsp;1, 2016 through December&nbsp;31, 2016, the Company repurchased 31&nbsp;million shares
	of common stock for $2.307 billion pursuant to trading plans under Rule 10b5-1 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;). In connection with entering into the Merger Agreement, the Company discontinued share
	repurchases under the stock repurchase program.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During 2015, the Company finalized agreements relating to the
	construction and development of office and studio space in the Hudson Yards development on the west side of Manhattan in order to move its Corporate headquarters and New York City-based employees to the new space. Based on construction cost
	estimates and space projections as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, the Company expects to invest an additional $1.4 billion, excluding interest, in the Hudson Yards development project through 2019.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Cash Flows
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Cash and
	equivalents decreased by $616 million and $463 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively. Components of these changes are discussed below in more detail.
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_23"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Details of Cash provided by operations from continuing operations are as follows (millions):
</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	Includes interest income received of $141 million, $35 million and $50 million in 2016, 2015 and 2014,
	respectively.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	Includes income tax refunds received of $136 million, $142 million and $108 million in 2016, 2015 and 2014,
	respectively, and income tax sharing payments to TWC of $4 million in 2015.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Cash provided by operations
	from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 increased primarily due to higher Operating Income and lower net income taxes paid.&nbsp;Cash used by working capital increased slightly as higher theatrical and home entertainment
	accounts receivable were largely offset by the timing of payments for content and restructuring and severance and CME&#146;s repayment of the Senior Secured Notes and the TW Term Loan of approximately $280 million. Cash provided by operations from
	continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 increased primarily due to higher Operating Income and lower net income taxes paid due to the enactment of federal tax legislation, partially offset by higher cash used by working
	capital. Cash used by working capital increased primarily due to higher content investments and higher payments related to restructuring initiatives undertaken in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	65
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage67"></A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The change in Cash provided (used) by investing activities from continuing operations
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 was primarily due to the Company&#146;s investment in Hulu. Other investment proceeds, including available-for-sale securities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 primarily related to CME&#146;s
	repayment of the Senior Secured Notes and the TW Term Loan. The change in Cash provided (used) by investing activities from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to proceeds received in 2014 in connection
	with the Time Separation and from the sale of space in Time Warner Center. The remaining change in Cash provided (used) by investing activities from continuing operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was primarily due to the change in
	investment and acquisition spending.
</P>

	Cash used by financing activities from continuing operations for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 increased, reflecting increases in Debt repayments and cash used for other financing activities, partially offset by a decrease in

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TIME WARNER INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION - (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Repurchases of common stock as a result of discontinuing share repurchases under the stock repurchase program when the Company entered into the Merger Agreement. The increase in cash used for
	other financing activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 was due to premiums and costs paid in connection with the Debt Tender Offers of $968 million. Cash used by financing activities from continuing operations for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 decreased primarily due to a decrease in Repurchases of common stock and an increase in Borrowings, partially offset by an increase in Debt repayments. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company issued
	approximately 5&nbsp;million shares of common stock and received $165 million in connection with the exercise of stock options.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Outstanding Debt and Other Financing Arrangements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Outstanding Debt and Committed Financial Capacity
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2016, Time Warner had total committed capacity, defined as maximum available borrowings under various
	existing debt arrangements and cash and short-term investments, of $29.528 billion. Of this committed capacity, $5.162 billion was unused and $24.339 billion was outstanding as debt. At December&nbsp;31, 2016, total committed capacity, outstanding
	letters of credit, outstanding debt and total unused committed capacity were as follows (millions):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	The revolving credit facilities, commercial paper program and public debt of the Company rank pari passu with
	the senior debt of the respective obligors thereon. The weighted average maturity of the Company&#146;s outstanding debt and other financing arrangements was 11.4 years as of December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	Represents the portion of committed capacity, including from bilateral letter of credit facilities, reserved
	for outstanding and undrawn letters of credit.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	Represents principal amounts adjusted for premiums and discounts and $104 million of unamortized debt issuance
	costs. At December&nbsp;31, 2016, the principal amounts of the Company&#146;s publicly issued debt mature as follows: $500 million in 2017, $600 million in 2018, $650 million in 2019, $1.400 billion in 2020, $2.000 billion in 2021 and $17.767
	billion thereafter. In the period after 2021, no more than $2.0 billion will mature in any given year.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	The revolving credit facilities consist of two $2.5 billion revolving credit facilities that mature in December
	2021. The Company may issue unsecured commercial paper notes up to the amount of the unused committed capacity under the revolving credit facilities. Unsecured commercial paper notes issued by the Company typically mature in less than 90 days.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	(e)
</TD>

	Unused committed capacity includes committed financings of subsidiaries under local bank credit agreements.
	Other debt obligations totaling $53 million are due within the next twelve months.
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">

<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TIME WARNER INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION - (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Debt Offerings
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On May&nbsp;10, 2016, Time&nbsp;Warner issued $800 million aggregate principal amount of 2.95% Notes due 2026 under a shelf
	registration statement. On December&nbsp;8, 2016, Time Warner issued $1.5 billion aggregate principal amount of 3.80% Notes due 2027 under a shelf registration statement. The net proceeds to the Company from these debt offerings were $2.272 billion,
	after deducting underwriting discounts and offering expenses. All of the notes issued are guaranteed, on an unsecured basis, by Historic TW Inc. (&#147;Historic TW&#148;). In addition, Turner and Home Box Office guarantee, on an unsecured basis,
	Historic TW&#146;s guarantee of the notes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Debt Tender Offers
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On December&nbsp;14, 2016, Time&nbsp;Warner purchased through cash tender offers $3.0 billion aggregate principal amount of
	its outstanding debt from the following series: 7.700% Debentures due 2032, 7.625% Debentures due 2031, 6.500% Debentures due 2036 and 6.625% Debentures due 2029, each of which continues to have amounts outstanding. The premiums paid and costs
	incurred in connection with this purchase were $1.008 billion for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and were recorded in Other loss, net in the accompanying Consolidated Statement of Operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Revolving Credit Facilities
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On December&nbsp;16, 2016, Time Warner amended its Revolving Credit Facilities, which consist of two $2.5 billion revolving
	credit facilities, to extend the maturity dates of both facilities from December&nbsp;18, 2020 to December&nbsp;18, 2021 and eliminate the swingline loan subfacility included in one of its facilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The funding commitments under the Revolving Credit Facilities are provided by a geographically diverse group of 18&nbsp;major
	financial institutions based in countries including Canada, France, Germany, Japan, Spain, Switzerland, the United Kingdom and the U.S. In addition, 17 of these financial institutions have been identified by international regulators as among the 30
	financial institutions that they deem to be systemically important. None of the financial institutions in the Revolving Credit Facilities account for more than 8% of the aggregate undrawn loan commitments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Commercial Paper Program
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Company has a commercial paper program, which was established on February&nbsp;16, 2011 on a private placement basis,
	under which Time Warner may issue unsecured commercial paper notes up to a maximum aggregate amount not to exceed the unused committed capacity under the Revolving Credit Facilities, which support the commercial paper program. At December&nbsp;31,
	2016, the Company had $1.394 billion of commercial paper outstanding, which is supported by the Revolving Credit Facilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Additional Information
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The obligations of each of the borrowers under the Revolving Credit Facilities and the obligations of Time Warner
	under the commercial paper program and the Company&#146;s outstanding publicly issued debt are directly or indirectly guaranteed on an unsecured basis by Historic TW, Home Box Office and Turner (other than $528 million of outstanding debt publicly
	issued by Time Warner in 2006, which is not guaranteed by Home Box Office). See Note&nbsp;9, &#147;Long-Term Debt and Other Financing Arrangements,&#148; to the accompanying consolidated financial statements for additional information regarding the
	Company&#146;s outstanding debt and other financing arrangements, including certain information about maturities, interest rates, covenants, rating triggers and bank credit agreement leverage ratios relating to such debt and financing arrangements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	68
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage70"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D300508D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TIME WARNER INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	OF RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION - (Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Contractual and Other Obligations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Contractual Obligations
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In addition to the financing arrangements discussed above, the Company has obligations under certain contractual arrangements
	to make future payments for goods and services. These contractual obligations secure the future rights to various assets and services to be used in the normal course of operations. For example, the Company is contractually committed to make certain
	minimum lease payments for the use of property under operating lease agreements. In accordance with applicable accounting rules, the future rights and obligations pertaining to certain firm commitments, such as operating lease obligations and
	certain purchase obligations under contracts, are not reflected as assets or liabilities in the accompanying Consolidated Balance Sheet.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The following table summarizes the Company&#146;s aggregate contractual obligations at December&nbsp;31, 2016, and the
	estimated timing and effect that such obligations are expected to have on the Company&#146;s liquidity and cash flows in future periods (millions):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
